subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: In the historical Chinese dictionary {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} ({{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}), this character is written in the form of ⿰{{l|mul|[[亻]][[夲]]}}.

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[體]]}} ''(Orthodox {{w|Traditional Chinese characters|traditional form}} of 体)''

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* Readings as traditional 体 ([[coarse]]; [[inferior]]):
*: ''ban6'' (Cantonese), ''bèn'' (Mandarin), ''bun'' (Korean), ''hon'' (Japanese).
* Readings as simplification of 體 ([[body]]; [[group]]):
*: ''tai2'' (Cantonese), ''tǐ'' (Mandarin), ''che'' (Korean), ''tei'' or ''tai'' (Japanese), ''thể'' (Vietnamese).
